case_vignette: A 70-year-old man is brought to the emergency department because of severe back pain that began when he was lifting a box 1 hour ago. He also has a 2-year history of increasingly severe right hip pain. Physical examination shows tenderness to palpation of the lower spine as well as erythema of the skin over the right hip. Neurologic examination shows decreased hearing in the left ear; the Weber test localizes to the left side. Serum studies show an alkaline phosphatase concentration of 410 U/L, calcium concentration of 9.5 mg/dL, and parathyroid hormone level of 322 pg/mL. An x-ray of the spine shows a fracture of the L4 vertebra.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Endocrinology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have severe back pain that started an hour ago when I was lifting a box, and I've been experiencing increasingly severe pain in my right hip for 2 years now.

Yes, the pain in my hip has been getting worse over the past two years.
Have you noticed any stiffness in your hip, particularly in the morning?
I haven't mentioned experiencing stiffness in my hip in the morning.
Do you have any swelling, redness, or warmth over the hip or any other joint?
There is redness of the skin over my right hip.
Have you experienced any recent weight changes, fevers, chills, or night sweats?
I haven't mentioned any weight changes, fevers, chills, or night sweats.
Do you have any chronic illnesses or have you been diagnosed with any autoimmune conditions?
I haven't mentioned any chronic illnesses or autoimmune conditions.
Have you had any previous injuries or surgeries to your right hip?
I haven't mentioned any previous injuries or surgeries to my right hip.
Are you currently taking any medications or supplements?
I haven't mentioned taking any medications or supplements.
Do you have a family history of joint disease or autoimmune disorders?
I haven't mentioned any family history of joint disease or autoimmune disorders.
What is your age and sex?
I am a 70-year-old man.
Final Diagnosis: Hip osteoarthritis with possible acute exacerbation or progression.
